channel.title: Findcolorspiral info please?
channel.description:
ok well when you use findcolorspiral does it spiral from the outside borders to the center or from center to outside?
if it starts at the outside is there a way to make it do the opposite like find the color closest to you?

item.title: Findcolorspiral info please?
item.dc:creator: @Jared Jared
item.description:
@Jared wrote:

oh thanks

well wouldnt this procedure be better for mining and wcing than searching the outer rim to the center

Read full topic

item.title: Findcolorspiral info please?
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

I never knew that. I just did a test to see, and I started with my mosue of the screen, and it returned 1, and 1. I assumed it started from that point then. That could come in handy, I never knew that.

Read full topic

item.title: Findcolorspiral info please?
item.dc:creator: @Pyro Pyro
item.description:
@Pyro wrote:

Yip yip rob is right. Its starts spiraling outwards from the x and y inputs you give it. Findcolor will start at top left hand corner. It is very easy to make other ones starting from bottem or top or corners etc

Read full topic

item.title: Findcolorspiral info please?
item.dc:creator: @roberty_bob roberty bob
item.description:
@roberty_bob wrote:

It actually starts the spiral from the current values of x,y not from the top left of the box…

but cheesehunk’s procedure is a cool idea for increasing your search box and saving misclicks/ time.

If you want to start a search from the centre of MS for example… set your x/y inputs to MSCX and MSCY respectively (if using SRL of course.)

Read full topic

item.title: Findcolorspiral info please?
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

FindColorSpiral starts at the top left hand corner.

Just make the box smaller, and in the middle if you want to make it find something closer to you, then increase the box size if it isn’t found.

Something like this:

Function FindColorInBoxIncreasingSize(x1, y1, x2, y2, color, increase : integer) : Boolean; var x, y, w, h : integer; begin GetClientDimensions(w,h); Result:=False; repeat x1:=x1-increase; //Makes the box ten pixels bigger each time. y1:=y1-increase; x2:=x2+increase; Y2:=y2+increase; wait(10); until FindColorSpiral(x,y,Color,x1,y1,x2,y2) or (x1>0) or (y1>0) or (x2<w) or (y1<h); if FindColorSpiral(x,y,Color,x1,y1,x2,y2) then Result:=True; end; begin if FindColorInBoxIncreasingSize(205,305,295,395,16777215,5) then writeln('Color found'); end.

Read full topic
